text: Marilyn B. Young (April 25, 1937 - February 19, 2017) was an American historian of American foreign relations. She served as professor of history at New York University. In 2000, she was awarded a Guggenheim Fellowship and an American Council of Learned Societies Fellowship, and the Berkshire Women's History Prize for The Vietnam Wars, 1945â€“1990. She was elected President of the Society for Historians of American Foreign Relations in 2011. Young died in New York on February 19, 2017, aged 79. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American historians Category:Educators from New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Marilyn B. Young
